bibl.title: Letter from Merritte W. Ireland to Philip Showalter Hench, October 8, 1941

div1.p: Ireland informs Hench that Truby's yellow fever article will be published in the Medical Department Bulletin.

div1.head: Letter from Merritte W. Ireland to Philip Showalter Hench, October 8, 1941
div1.opener:
1870 Wyoming Ave.,
Washington, D.C.,
October 8, 1941
Doctor Philip B. Hench,
Mayo Clinic,
Rochester, Minn.
My dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
Thank you for your letter of October 1st. The copy of
Hygeia came yesterday and is on my desk. I have just come from
Kean's house where we signed the photographs you had en-
larged. I remarked to Kean that it was nice of you to want
them for your collection but that I didn't think they were
anything to write home about.

Truby is completing his manuscript and I expect Kean
has told you that the Surgeon General's Office has promised
to publish it all in one issue of the Medical Department
Bulletin. I think Truby's story is something that will at-
tract attention in the profession.
div1.closer: Very sincerely yours, M. W. Ireland *ML
